entry.title: Comment 1
entry.content:
Is the plan to have people wandering around aimlessly asking which room the "unconference" is in ?

Where is the venue for this exactly ?

The School of Oriental and African Studies has two campus locations.

http://www.soas.ac.uk/visitors/location/maps/

Is it at the Russell Square Campus ?

School of Oriental and African Studies, University of London
Thornhaugh Street
Russell Square
London
WC1H 0XG

or is it at the Vernon Square Campus ?

School of Oriental and African Studies, University of London
Vernon Square
Penton Rise
London
WC1X 9EW

This event does not appear on either the BarCamp wiki events list for the United Kingdom

http://barcamp.org/w/page/402984/FrontPage

Neither doe sit appear on the SOAS events calendar

http://www.soas.ac.uk/about/events/index.php?nd=2011-03-07&view=week

entry.title: Comment 2
entry.content: I updated the info. It is not an official barcamp event, and I don't know why SOAS doesn't have it listed in their events. It is the Russell Square campus.

entry.title: Comment 3
entry.content:
Do you have any information about where at SOAS the meeting is taking place? I'd like to attend but I can't find any information on the SOAS website.

Cheers!

entry.title: Comment 4
entry.content:
This was setup as a last minute request as SOS offer many rooms to off-topic subjects nothing at all to do with unversity main subject matter. The aim so long as its legal is simply to generate extra income

Johanthan Leslie

entry.title: Comment 5
entry.content:
Hi there,

is there an online forum to discuss tor? I'm a user in china running tor nodes and would like to help and learn how to set up nodes correctly. Where should I direct my questions?

regards,
noname

entry.title: Comment 6
entry.content: There is no forum for tor, or conversely, there are many forums, but none are official. Do your tor nodes connect to the rest of the internet?

entry.title: Comment 7
entry.content: Sorry, this is OT, but don't know where else to post it. Tor browser bundle for Windows 1.3.18 is reporting that the SSL cert for blog.torproject.org expired on 3/7/2011. This almost certainly benign (I ignored it to post this), but it does need to be corrected.

entry.title: Comment 8
entry.content: I'll skip my rant about the futility of the CA model and just post this instead, https://blog.torproject.org/blog/life-without-ca

entry.content: Did this workshop produce video, prez’ or notes ?

entry.content: The participants agreed everything was off the record for this gathering.
